## Using git

git is a command line version control system. We can use it from RStudio (via the "git pane" in the upper left) or from the command line (i.e.in the "terminal tab").

The steps to using git involve:
 1. Initiate a git repository
      git init
      or click the little box in RStudio 
 2. Do your work (same as ever)
      add files 
      edit files
      save files
 3. **Add files you care about to the "stage"**
      git add your_file_names
      or click to add to "stage" in RStudio
 4. **Commit your changes**
      git commit -m "your message"
      or click the *commit* button in RSdtudio
